title: Judge saves the CFPB, for now
snippets: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction to prevent the Trump administration and the Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) pending the outcome of an ongoing court case.
summary: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction to stop the Trump administration and the Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) until a court case about the matter is resolved.

title: Windows 11 is closing a loophole that let you skip making a Microsoft account
snippets: Microsoft has updated its Windows 11 Insider Preview, removing a bypass script that previously allowed users to set up the operating system without an internet connection and logging in. This change enforces the requirement for all Windows 11 devices to be connected to the internet and logged into an account during setup.
summary: Microsoft has updated its Windows 11 Insider Preview, eliminating a script that enabled users to install the operating system without an internet connection and without logging in. Now, setting up Windows 11 requires an internet connection and account login for all devices.

title: The 30 best Amazon Big Spring Sale deals under $30
snippets: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is currently underway and will continue until Monday, March 31st. The sale offers a wide range of deals that are accessible without needing an Amazon Prime membership. The main roundup includes over 100 deals on popular gear, and there's also a focus on providing low-cost alternatives for shoppers.
summary: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is ongoing until March 31st, featuring over 100 deals on popular items. These deals are available to all shoppers, without requiring an Amazon Prime membership, and include a variety of low-cost alternatives.

title: Elon Musk’s xAI buys Elon Musk’s X for $33 billion on paper
snippets: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has acquired the social media platform X (previously Twitter) in an all-stock deal. Musk, who bought Twitter a few years ago for $44 billion, announced the transaction values xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, which includes $12 billion of debt.
summary: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has acquired the social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter) in an all-stock transaction. The deal values xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, incorporating $12 billion in debt. Musk previously purchased Twitter for $44 billion before this acquisition.

title: Microsoft tests Quick Machine Recovery to restore PCs that can’t boot
snippets: Microsoft has begun testing Quick Machine Recovery in its latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653), aimed at enabling IT professionals to remotely recover Windows 11 devices that fail to boot. This feature, first announced last year, is designed to prevent incidents similar to the previous Crowdstrike catastrophe.
summary: Microsoft is testing a new feature called Quick Machine Recovery in the latest Windows Insider Preview build for Windows 11, version 6120.3653. This tool allows IT professionals to remotely restore devices that cannot boot, aiming to avoid situations like the Crowdstrike incident.

title: The Fitbit-to-Google account migration deadline moves to 2026
snippets: Google has extended the deadline for Fitbit users to migrate their accounts to a Google account until next year, following its acquisition of Fitbit in early 2021. Initially, users were required to complete this migration by 2025, but a recent email to Fitbit users announced the extension.
summary: Google has postponed the deadline for Fitbit users to switch their accounts to Google accounts to next year, following its purchase of Fitbit in 2021. The original deadline was set for 2025, but Fitbit users were informed of the extension through a recent email.

title: The Trump administration could green-light deep-sea mining for the first time
